title: Northwestern Football Players Lose Bid For Union
text:
Northwestern Football Players Lose Bid For Union Written by: Eric Reed 08/17/15 - 6:04 PM EDT NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) -- The Northwestern University football union is dead, just in time for kickoff. 
In a unanimous decision released Monday morning, the National Labor Relations Board defeated the unionization efforts of a group of Northwestern football players, choosing not to assert jurisdiction over the case. Although the five-member board specifically declined to rule on the substantive question of whether college football players are employees, the ruling makes them ineligible for collective bargaining protection under the National Labor Relations Act. This decision overturns a previous ruling in favor of the students by the Chicago regional office of the NLRB. 
Itâ€™s a significant setback for what has become an increasingly tense question in college sports. Players at many elite football schools have begun to challenge the traditional concept of the student-athlete, citing issues such as 14-hour days, informal compensation in the form of player scholarships and the billion-dollar NCAA industry as evidence that a college football player is closer to a paid employee than a typical undergrad.
